intro: Gardoquia betonicoides, commonly known as the common gardoquia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, spicy scent. Gardoquia betonicoides is often found in meadows and along roadsides, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
